Please provide URLs, not just numbers here. Likely you'll need to separate them out, so:

```
... downstream devices[1][2]. ...

[1]: https://...
[2]: https://...
```
Done, as your suggestion.
Done

Perhaps:

> Mark them as stable to make to make the symbols visible

?
Done, as your suggestion.
Done

Hi Unive, thanks for the change. There's some information on both the considerations when creating stabilisation patches in the changes checklist:

https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/docs/checklists/changes.md#stabilising-an-existing-api

Please make sure to address all the points there 😊

An important part of the stabilisation is updating the ABI dump. If you'd like to tackle that on your own there are some hints in the section that follows:

https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/docs/checklists/changes.md#updating-an-abi-dump

(in fact, that documentation should be updated, as there's now a script you can run from inside the container that handles the process).

However, if you'd like me to do that for you please let me know.

I have some other comments inline.

Thank you for the review, due to this patch is based on previous one, which has not yet figure out to be nessesarily merged or not, so let me handle that one first, and then I'll turn back to this section. The corrections you've indecated below have all been solved.

> However, if you'd like me to do that for you please let me know.

Apologies for the trouble, but I'm not very familiar with how to dump the ABI. Could you help me with it this time?

> I've removed guards from the function's tests so they are always compiled

Oops, missed from last patchset, pushed.

> Apologies for the trouble, but I'm not very familiar with how to dump the ABI. Could you help me with it this time?

Ah, so there are some hints here:

https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/docs/checklists/changes.md#updating-an-abi-dump

However, this is also slightly out of date as we now have this script that you can run from inside the container:

https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/scripts/abi-dump-updater

That said, what's not described above is how to build the OpenBMC CI container locally. There are some more hints here:

https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/testing/local-ci-build.md

Let me know if you need any further info.
Thanks for the information, done.
Thanks for the rework. I've made some comments on the linked patches.

Hi Unive,

As a general note I don't merge stablisation patches until the comments on the linked changes are resolved. There's still the issue of the subsequent parsing that's not yet implemented in libpldm in the first patch. I'd like to get that resolved before we merge this, as it may impact API decisions.

The linked changes refer to pldm/[70731] and pldm/[70732] are now merged to one patch pldm/[75390], all of the reviewer's suggestion are applied to the new patch, rebased and reset this patch to active.

[70731]: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/70731
[70732]: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/70732
[75390]: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/75390
I'm going to let this simmer for a bit while we get some feedback on the linked change.
Hi Unive, thanks for the change. I have some requests inline.

Hi Andrew, thanks for the review and mentioning the problem,
to avoid confusion, the return type revision has been made in [#75955], and has [#75954] dependency to add internal `encode_pldm_header_only_errno()` API, this patch has been rebased onto them, due to the fixes are done in those patches, the rest of the inline requests are marked as resolved.

[#75955]: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/75955
[#75954]: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/75954

Before we accept any of these functions as stable, can we please make sure they meet as much of the changes checklist as possible? For instance, anything returning PLDM completion codes should be fixed to return negative errnos before being marked stable.

The documentation should also be fixed as a consequence.
Done
Again for this function.
Done
Hmm, this was a consistency bug...
Again for this function.
Done
Again for this function.
Done

Hi Unive, thanks for the help so far with fixing the API design prior to stabilisation. However, there are other elements of the changes checklist that apply to these APIs as well, such as [not decomposing message members into individual function parameters](https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/main/docs/checklists/changes.md?plain=1#L117-L124). Again, prior to stabilisation, I prefer we get these addressed. I've left some comments inline.

Thanks again for the review, revision of parameter squashing is made in [#75960], this patch has been rebased.

[#75960]: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/75960
This should take a struct pointer argument rather than the decomposed values.
Done
Again, let's make this take a struct pointer rather than decomposed values.
Done

So before we stabilise this I would prefer we rework the related APIs (`decode_get_downstream_firmware_params_resp()`, `decode_downstream_device_parameter_table_entry()`, `decode_downstream_device_parameter_table_entry_versions()`) to use the iterator form we have for the downstream devices.

Give me a short while to sort out how we might go about this effort. I'm going to try not hold up this stabilisation request and I'm not asking you to do it yourself, but feel free to let me know you're taking up the work if you feel comfortable with doing so.

Thanks a lot for the help 😊, I'll handle the [pldm/75390] with the incoming corresponding change.

[pldm/75390]: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/75390
No worries. I'll get this reworked.

So my current understanding of the situation is that there are issues with the OpenBIC PLDM implementation that are driving incorrect choices in the associated pldmd patch. Until that changes or someone corrects my understanding, I plan to defer considering this for merging.
